page.title: 11Pargetting in Henham
page.content: Pargetting is patterns in plaster on the outside of houses .It protected old wooden houses.There are several reasons why you could have had it,because it looks nice,it shows you are rich and shows you have good taste.Different designs for the plaster are simple patterns,or pictures.Simple patterns are most common.Pargetting first began in the 1500s and 1600s but died out and became popular again in the 1900.To pargette you spread the plaster on a wall,and make the pattern on it with a stick or with special tools ,they sometimes use moulds .Pargetting is very common in NW Essex.400 years ago pargette was made of lime plaster which was very weak and runny so it was thickened with hair ,straw ,wood shavings .cheese & manure.Nowadays cement plaster is usually used.
